title: England named one of the world's best countries to visit in 2020 by Lonely Planet
text:

England has been named one of the world's best countries that tourists need to visit for 2020.

The British hotspot's rich history, breathtaking countryside (and coast), and iconic landmarks from Stonehenge to Buckingham Palace - not to mention the incredible English Heritage sites to explore - have long established it as a tourist favourite.

As Hugh Grant famously pointed out in Love Actually, it's home to highlights including Shakespeare, Churchill, The Beatles, Harry Potter, David Beckham’s right foot - and David Beckham’s left foot.

Therefore it's no surprise that England took second place in the top 10 list as part of Lonely Planet's annual Best in Travel round-up.

In fact, England wowed the panel of judges thanks to its "timeless treasures" such as the breathtaking castles and cathedrals to be found, the villages and the countryside.

However, it's the iconic seaside (and the experience of tucking into fish and chips) which has seen England tipped to be a must-visit destination next year.

In fact, as the England Coast Path opens new sections in 2020, it will eventually become the longest continuous trail of its kind in the world, granting access to the country’s entire coastline for the first time.

(Image: Getty Images)

According to Lonely Planet, Northumberland's coast, the Norfolk Coast and the South West Coast Path are just some of the places visitors won't want to miss out on.

As for the country that pipped England to the post to be crowned the best to visit in 2020?

Bhutan was the winner, having long been a firm favourite with intrepid explorers thanks to its varied landscapes (think everything from mountains to picturesque rivers), as well as its breathtaking monasteries and fortresses.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

Bhutan was also the setting for Prince William and Kate Middleton's royal tour in 2016 where they met with royal couple King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck and his wife Jetsun Pema, and also took on a gruelling six-hour trek to the Tiger's Next monastery.
